did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, patents, business records, printed matter, and photographs, relating to the meat and fish refrigeration industries.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], M. T. (Mikhail Trofimovich) Zarochentsev papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2001.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: Originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

chronitem.event: Graduated, Institut putei soobshcheniia, Moscow, Russia
Graduated, Moskovskii kommercheskii institut, Moscow, Russia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Mikhail Trofimovich Zarochentsev (Zarotschenzeff) was a specialist in meat and fish refrigeration, a prolific inventor in the field and holder of a number of patents on methods of quick-freezing. The CAREER FILE contains information related to Zarochentsev's scientific work (notes, reports and calculations) and business activities, including his meat-packing operations: A/S "Külmetus"(Estonia), American Z Corporation, National Frosted Foods Sales Corp. and Z-Pack Corporation. It also includes articles, notes, patents, and promotional materials relating to the "Z" process of quick-freezing and related refrigeration issues.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Calling cards, clippings, curriculum vitae, diploma, membership certificates, receipts, and subject file, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Card and letters, arranged alphabetically by correspondent
Articles, interviews, and scrapbook, arranged chronologically by title
Business records, patents, scientific notes and subject file, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Brochures and clippings, arranged alphabetically by subject
Primarily works on refrigeration, food processing, fox breeding, and meat- and fish-packing not directly related to Zarochentsev or his work. Not filmed
Albums and loose prints depicting Zarochentsev, frozen foods and food processing operations, places he visited and various individuals. Not filmed

note.p: See also CAREER FILE for materials relating to Z's professional activities in this field

scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, poems and speeches read at the jubilee celebration
Correspondence and clippings relating to his conflict with Zarochentsev

note.p: See also BIOGRAPHICAL FILE/Subject file for correspondence relating to Zarochentsev's jubilee and conflict with A. Voloshin
See also CAREER FILE for scientific notes and business reports and promotional materials, and scientific reports and patents

scopecontent.p: Includes articles citing Z's words and opinions
Includes primarily clippings of newspaper articles and some typescripts

did.unittitle: Volume of Zarochentsev's pre-Revolutionary books, articles, and reports to scientific congresses.

scopecontent.p: Includes Kholodil'noe dielo (Moscow, 1911), Kholod v plodovodstvie (Simferopol', 1911), Ledniki (Moscow, 1912), and other works

did.unittitle: "Kholodil'noe delo, ego printsipy i znachenie," n.d.
"Tekhnika khraneniia i perevozki baraniny," and "Osnovnye voprosy kommercheskoi eksploatatsii kholodnykh skladov," Trudy VI-go s'iezda po kholodil'nomu dielu v Moskvie, 1913.
Kholod - drug cheloveka," public lecture, 1925 October 15.

scopecontent.p: Typescript. Includes advertisements and programs for the lecture from 1932 to 1951

did.unittitle: "Precooling Stations in Russia," Refrigerating World, 1927 October.
"Chilling in Bacon Factories," Ice and Cold Storage, 1927 December-1928 January.
"Schnellkühlprozess geschlachteter Schweine bei der Herstellung von Bacon," Zeitschrift für Eis- und Kälte-Industrie, 1928.
"Congélation rapide de viande et de poisson à l'entrepôt frigorifique de Paris-Vaugirard," Et des industries frigorifiques, 1929 February-March.
"Quick Freezing of Various Meat Cuts and Edible Offals," Meat Trades' Journal, 1930 April 17.
"Rapid Chilling and Freezing of Fish and Meat in Atomised Brine," Ice and Cold Storage, 1930 August.

"Latest Achievements in Rapid Freezing and Chilling Methods," paper read before a meeting of the British Association of Refrigeration, at the Hall of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Storey's Gate, Westminster, S.W., England, 1930 December 4.

scopecontent.p: Printed copy and abstract from proceedings

did.unittitle: "Conservation of Fish on Trawlers," The Fish Trades Gazette, 1931 April 25.
"Preservation of Fish on Trawlers," The Fish Trades Gazette, 1931 June 27.
"Quick-Freezing Opening New Perspectives in the Fish Industry," paper presented at the International Fisheries Congress, Paris, France, 1931 July 20-25.
"Dry and Wet Freezing in the Meat Industry," Ice and Refrigeration, 1932 February.
"Neues vom 'Z'-Schnellgefrier-Verfahren in Amerika," Die Kälte-Industrie, 1932 November.
"The Z Process on Packaged Food Manufacturing," Ice and Refrigeration, 1932 November.
"Quick Freezing Abroad," letter to the editor, Refrigeration, 1933 July.
"Refrigeration of Fish in Newfoundland," Refrigeration, 1933 October.
"Quick Freezing Poultry," The National Provisioner, 1933 December 9.
"Refrigeration of Fish in Newfoundland," Cold Storage and Produce Review, 1934 February 15.

"Fish Freezing Advances in Newfoundland," Fishing Gazette, 1934 July.

"El Sistema 'Z' en Norteamerica," Industrias pesqueras, 1934 December 15.
"Want to Be Van Winkle? Try Freezing Process," Rochester Democrat and Chronicle, 1935 August 18.
"The Practical Application of Refrigeration in the Fishing Industry," Refrigeration and Air Conditioning, 1935 September.
"The Quick Freezing and Marketing of Ducks," Ice and Refrigeration, 1936 July.

"Schnellgefrieranlage für Enten in Amerika," Die Kälte-Industrie, 1936 September.
"How 'Z' Quick-Freezing Process Is Used By the Long Island Duck Industry," Refrigeration News, 1936 September 2.

"Quick Frozen Foods for the World Armies," Quick Frozen Foods, 1938 October 15.
"World Wide Development of Quick Freezing," Quick Frozen Foods, 1938 December 15.

"How Quick Frozen Foods Came Into Being - And Stayed," Quick Frozen Foods, 1939 February 15.
"The Altek System of Refrigerated Transport in Europe," Ice and Refrigeration, 1939 April-May.
"Quick Freezing Shows Progress in Foreign Fisheries," Quick Frozen Foods, 1939 May 15.
"Quick-Frozen Meat Supplies: Efficient Distribution for the Forces and Civilian Population," Modern Refrigeration, 1939 December 21.
"'Flexible Froster' Experiments," American Egg and Poultry Review, 1940 March.
"New Plan for Wartime Meat Handling," The National Provisioner, 1940 March 30.
"Frosted Foods in the Ice and Cold Storage Industry," Ice and Refrigeration, 1941 February.
"Sovremennoe miasnoe snabzhenie armii i naseleniia," 1941 December 2.
"La congelación rapida en el progreso argentino," Revista argentina del frio, 1942 May-June.
"Quick Freezing Lamb in Tierra del Fuego," The National Provisioner, 1942 September 12.
"South America Looms Big as Seafood Production Source," Fishing Gazette, 1942 November.
"Quick Freezing of Meats in South America," Refrigerating Engineering, 1943 August.
"Sovremennoe polozhenie sushki pishchevykh produktov v S. Sh. Severnoi Ameriki," 1943 October 15.
"Will Argentine Imports Spur Quick Freezing in the U.S.?" Meat, 1944 January.
"Sterilization of Meat By Electronic Heating," Quick Frozen Foods, 1944 May-June.
"Will Dielectric Heating Pave the Way for South American Meat?" Meat, 1944 December.
"Nasha pishcha segodnia i posle voiny," Novaia zaria, 1945 August 7-8.
"Quality Control: A 1946 Problem," Frosted Food Field, 1946 January.
"Frozen Berries in Alaska," Western Frozen Foods, 1947 January.
"Posledniaia para liudei na zemle," Novaia zaria, 1948 January 23-27.
Fakty moei zhizni," Novaia zaria, 1949 May 18-28.
"Iubilei V. G. Mamul'ian," Novaia zaria, 1949 September 22.

note.p: See also SPEECHES AND WRITINGS for articles on refrigeration and food processing

scopecontent.p: Includes scientific notes and business-related interviews and promotional materials authored by M. T. and W. M. Zarochentsev.
Includes articles about or mentioning Zarochentsev and son and their discoveries, inventions and business activities, and scientific memoranda and reports
Includes reports of the general manager (Zarochentsev), clippings, correspondence, instructions, regulations, and price lists
Also known as International Z Corporation
Includes articles by Zarochentsev's son, W. M. Zee, correspondence, and promotional materials
Includes brochures, clippings, and promotional materials
Patents on methods and equipment for freezing food products, arranged alphabetically by author
Includes patents and lists of those applied for and granted, as well as diagrams of refrigeration equipment

note.p: For its implementation and industrial use, as well as for articles about it, see American Z Corporation

scopecontent.p: Includes articles by W. M. Zarochentsev and issues of Quick Frozen Foods, on whose advisory board M. T. Zarochentsev served
Primarily works on refrigeration, food processing, fox breeding, and meat- and fish-packing not directly related to Zarochentsev or his work
Albums and loose prints depicting Zarochentsev, frozen foods and food processing operations, places he visited and various individuals
